page.title: 20DUNDEE LAW
page.content: {LAW: n. a roundish or conical hill.} {(Chamber's Scots Dictionary). The LAW is a volcanic plug, 571 feet high, dominating the skyline of Dundee. On the top, there is a{stone {pedestal}with a chart that identifies prominent landmarks. There is also a{war memorial}to commemorate the servicemen who died in both World Wars. A beacon is lit each year on{Armistice Day,}the anniversary of the{Battle of Loos}and{United {Nations Day. From the top, the whole Tay estuary, the hills of Fife and the Sidlaws up to Perth can be seen. There are signs that at one time there was an{ancient {hill fort.}(The "dun" of Dundee signifies a hill fort). There used to be a{railway tunnel} going through the hill, but now the tunnel is disused and blocked up.
